column4: I get an error when trying to install my printer (server-error-internal-error) and I am not sure why. I installed the drivers from Lexmark, but still having no success. Can anyone help?
when I connect to localhost:631/printers it shows 0 out of 3 printers and I am not sure why
Can someone please help me install my Lexmark Z2300 printer?
if it is supported.  Plug it in and go to system > administration > printers    and add it.
if it was that simple, do you think I would be in here? :-p
sorry
Lexmark has drivers for it, but it doesn't seem to work after I install them. and Adding through the method you suggested causes an error.
yeah I am not sure how to help with that.   You might use the http://localhost:631/   interface rather than the ubuntu pygtk one
it shows 0 of 3 printers when I click to manage
what model number was it?
Lexmark Z2300
did you install from a .deb?
yes
did you run:  sudo /etc/init.d/cups restart
don't think so... but the system has been restarted. Shouldn't that do the same thing?
yes
so I am not sure,  as far as I can tell, it should be working .   Perhaps uninstall and then use the .tar.gz instead.
the website only mentions support for 8.04, but I wouldn't think it would matter
I didn't see that, I'll give that a shot perhaps. And yeah, I didn't think version should matter. How do I clear the three printers in there?
normally you click on Delete Printer, but you said it didn't show any right, but rather 0 of 3 printers
ie I'm not sure
Wouldn't it be better to let it autodetect the fs type?
probably, as long as it does
